name: ferment
description: Peer-to-peer audio publishing and streaming application. Like SoundCloud but decentralized. A mashup of ssb, webtorrent and electron.

packageJSON.name: ferment
packageJSON.description: Peer-to-peer audio publishing and streaming application. Like SoundCloud but decentralized. A mashup of ssb, webtorrent and electron.

commit.message:
initial commit! WOW!

isnâ€™t really functional as an app yet, HOWEVER
playback and seeding is working great!

Also started working on the shiny interface!

releases.body:
- fix displaying local peer posts in discovery feed
- never display more than 2 posts by the same person in a row in the discovery feed

- add more interface hints to explain [how seeding and publishing audio works](https://github.com/mmckegg/ferment#publishing-audio) and show the status more clearly.
- prevent post title length from messing with the view size

- use new persistent gossip in ssb (much more reliable replication to friends)
- include local peer posts in discovery feed
- display local peers in sidebar on discovery tab

- add media button support: play/pause, next, previous (thanks @emilbayes!! ðŸ’¯)
- fix **Save** button and show "convert" status
- allow selecting text in descriptions

**Makes replication more reliable by forcing reconnection to main pubs (any that you have accepted invites from) on publish**

This should allow newly added files to get pulled as soon as they are added rather than getting lost and no one ever getting to hear them (when original poster never comes back online).

**Fixed everything being completely broken by the last release**

This was caused by publishing 0.6.12 with the wrong version of mutant.

Streaming should be working properly again! ðŸŽ‰

- better display of torrent status
- on startup, seed rarest torrents first
- automatically seed from people you follow
- advance to next track if can't start playing after 30 seconds
- fix players getting "stuck" on
- include reposts in profile count

- add ability to save audio to your computer
- you can now repost other people's content

YAY those buttons finally do something!

- fixed adding audio on systems that don't have a global libopus installation
- now also generating a fallback mp3 version for mobile devices that don't support modern open audio codecs (iOS)

- show better error messages when audio convert fails
- allow all characters in names (let's just see what happens: we can always go back)

- display and sort by post time
- fix flickering torrent status

- switch to opus for audio encoding (better streaming, smaller files, higher quality)
- automatically resize and crop images before adding
- always include own posts on discovery page
- no longer requires manual install of ffmpeg
- show if there is a new version available
- fix initial connect to pub server not showing feeds

- you can now edit posts that you added previously
- added audio post view with description and likes
